titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A misty day until the afternoon, & then sunshine until nightfall. I prepared notes for my sermon, and, after an early lunch, motored with my chaplain to Blackhall for the "stone–laying" of the new church. There was Evensong in the temporary church when I preached on 1. Cor:III.II. "
For other foundation can no man lay than that which is laid which is Jesus Christ
". Then "processed" to the new church which is half–builded. There Alderman

, a local mine–owner, "laid" a "foundation stone" in the wall, high & lifted up with his name on it. I improvised a "dedicating prayer", and gave a Benediction. Then we returned to Auckland, & found the motor–cycling race in the Park proceeding. There was a serious accident, the unfortunate youth was carried to hospital.

The newspapers give prominence to another outburst against the Bishops from
of Barnard Castle. He takes up his parable against their incomes and palaces: & denounces their partiality in appointments! Well, well!
